    • Method Detail

      • generateHeaders

        protected static org.apache.http.Header[] generateHeaders(java.lang.String baseName,
                                                          java.lang.String arrayName,
                                                          int headers)
        Create the specified number of Headers.

        Generated header names will be the baseName plus its index or, rarely, the arrayName if it's supplied.

        Parameters:
        baseName - The base name to use for all headers.
        arrayName - The optional (nullable) array name to use randomly.
        headers - The number of headers to create.
        Returns:
        Never null.

      • addHeaders

        protected static void addHeaders(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.List<java.lang.String>> map,
                                 org.apache.http.Header[] defaultHeaders,
                                 org.apache.http.Header[] headers)
        Add the headers to the map so that related tests can more easily assert that they exist.

        If both the defaultHeaders and headers contain the same Header, based on its name, then this will only use the Header(s) from headers.

        Parameters:
        map - The map to build with name/value(s) pairs.
        defaultHeaders - The headers to add to the map representing default headers.
        headers - The headers to add to the map representing request-level headers.
        See Also:
        createOrAppendList(Map, String, String)
